website_summaries.verdict: While there are better performing drives out there, the 335 represents the peace of mind choice when buying an SSD.
cons: Better performing drives that give more capacity are around the same price

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Bought on September 27, 2013, writing review on April 15, 2014. No issues to date. Intel software works well, and the performance upgrade from my 10k RPM HDD was substantial. I use a 1TB drive for non-essential program installs and storage, and put my OS, Chrome and my most used programs on the SSD. Boot times are under 30 seconds from button press to idle desktop (Windows 7 x64).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: Fast! No problems or issues!
customer_reviews.text: No problems so far. Bought it to replace a stock 60GB SSD that came with my computer. Just make sure to optimize the drive and make sure you format it properly before you start using it heavily. I have to say though, SSD's for OS partitions... Simply awesome. Literally from a cold start, I can be on the internet in about 15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: ANG

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: _ Easy to install, _ The Disk image clone software works! _ No issues using Windows or Linux partitioning tools. _ Fast, and quite. You will notice the difference! You will never go back! _ Running Win7, and two Linux distributions, standard office suite, 3 Electronic CAD packages, and studio recording software, with plenty of room left. Re-purposed original 1Tara byte hard drive for data storage. Relocating windows and linux documents, music, and pictures folders to a common location on the 1Tara byte drive makes for efficient use of resources.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Craig

customer_reviews.title: Much faster than old hard drive
customer_reviews.text: The installation process went as advertised. I had no problems except an occasional system freeze up. This was almost totally alleviated by not optimizing the drive automatically and increasing the virtual memory used by Microsoft Windows. The virtual memory was set manually to 5-gigabytes (5,000,000,000 bytes) minimum and 10-gigabytes maximum in my case. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: RAB-213

customer_reviews.title: replacing smaller ssd
customer_reviews.text: adding a new game or two to my library...wanted a game/os ssd. have used intel ssd's for last two drives. enjoy the trim feature and the reliability. did not prep the new drive in any way. used intel migration software from their site. 20 minutes later and all my software still works on the 2x sized ssd
customer_reviews.author: 270bamf

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive has sped up my computer so much, I love it. I installed windows and some key programs on this drive, and still have plenty of space left. All of my media (music, videos, pictures, etc.) are on my 1TB HDD so no problems there. I highly recommend this drive, as it brings the speed of a SSD for a great price & size ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Alcantar

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, very easy to install with software.
customer_reviews.text: My wife's computer has been running on this hard drive for a long time now. We have had zero issues with this hard drive. It is VERY fast, the software to transfer files from the old hard drive is simple and works wonders. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: incredible drive
customer_reviews.text: Intel makes the best ssd drives out there. any one wanting to improve the performance of their computer be it a work computer or a gaming computer these are the ssd drives that you want. I had Crucial m4 ssd in my computer before I bought this. The crucial does not even come close to be a contender on this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Spencer Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Very fast. Had no trouble with it at all so far. I've had it for 2.5 months at the time of this posting. Games load faster, computer boots faster, pretty much everything is faster. It's large enough for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could have afforded a larger drive
customer_reviews.text: Hooked this up about a week ago and so far so good. Boot up is incredibly fast. LOVE THAT! Just wish I could have afforded a larger version, but anything about 240gb was just too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Kmill

customer_reviews.title: Installed easily, worked perfectly, noticeable PC speed up, reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: The free included transfer software (Acronis) also worked perfectly; I used it to copy the old boot disk complete with Windows 7 op system to the new SSD and it has been working without a hitch ever since.
customer_reviews.author: S. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of fast IDE hard drives but this was the first SSD, WOW they are fast. Will never go back to IDE Drive except for storage. So far it has been very reliable with no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: TOW

customer_reviews.title: Intel 335 Series 2.5-Inch 240GB SATA3 Solid State Drive SSDSC2CT240A4K5
customer_reviews.text: This Intel 335 Series 2.5 240GB SATA SSD works excellent. Boot and shutdown speeds are extremely fast. Programs open and operate without any problems! The price is right and I can highly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Vladan Simic

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Swapped this into my mid 2009 MacBook Pro and it was instantly turned into a different machine. I put it in over a year ago and am still very happy with the performance. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jawnolith

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, very stable!
customer_reviews.text: I got this SSD about three weeks ago and its been up and stable for 2 weeks now. I love it! Intel's are a little expensive but you are paying for the proven track record of stability and reliability. Would recommend to anyone looking for an SSD. As always SSD's require different user care than traditional platter drives. Always remember to do the research and invest the little amount of time in setup to get the most out of your investment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: replaced my X25M, three times as big, twice as fast, 1/3 the price
customer_reviews.text: The write speed is even more than twice as fast. This may seem like an expensive product to many, but the delivered performance is astonishing. My old SSD-based system was really fast. With this SSD, it's *really* fast.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Installed perfectly with Intel's migration software. Hope that it lasts but just in case I will partition the old one and install it as a mirrored drive. Reduced boot up time by ~75%
customer_reviews.author: Dave In Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Very fast drive and installation was a snap
customer_reviews.text: Very fast drive, product came with 3.5" bay frame, screws, speed demon sticker, safe packaging and software, my system boots up in less than 7 seconds using Win8 and clamshell to remove the windows touch screen GUI, running an i7 lga-1155 3770 cpu with 16gb memory on an Intel DH77DF motherboard. The installation was a snap and now it makes me never want to purchase another regular hard drive for bootup again. Since it was recently purchased I can't say how long it will last but i'll repost an update when it goes faulty.
customer_reviews.author: miketheman

customer_reviews.title: Startup time reduced from 90 seconds to 12 seconds - An outstanding product from Intel.
customer_reviews.text: The box includes all that you need to install and configure this in a laptop or in a desktop system.The adapter is included for the larger bay, as is the cable and free system transfer software link. My old laptop used to take 90 seconds to start from cold. It now takes 12 seconds and I'm in. Highly recommended product from an excellent seller (c8
customer_reviews.author: Fairfax Ache

customer_reviews.title: installed in older macbook pro
customer_reviews.text: marked increase in speed in my ~2008 macbook pro. system also runs cooler. no problems, hiccups, after 6 months of use. satisfied with this product, was worth what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: meep

customer_reviews.title: This SSD is solid, no complaints. The transfer ...
customer_reviews.text: This SSD is solid, no complaints. The transfer speeds are as advertised, works extremely well with windows 8 improved my boot times to less than 2 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: breathe life into an old MSI Platinum
customer_reviews.text: it's like a new ticker for an old codger...as i'm an old codger, I can appreciate that. these little things really boot up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Hon Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hard Disk
customer_reviews.text: excellent hard drive I recommend it to all my machine started but now super-tough lens a minute loading the operating system
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: My computer loads like a dream. This thing is crazy fast! Big thanks for Intel for making such a sweet hard drive! I put it on two computers!
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: item is as described and very well working ... didn't expect such a great item ... recommend this to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Jurgen

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded D820
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded D820 along with Windows 7 64 bit. Like a new laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Theo H.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how my old laptop could be. Installed well but can't seem to get it to work with sleep mode but since it boots in 6 secs who cares. Just using hibernation instead.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SSD from Intel!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old hard drive with Intel 335 series SSD. The hardware and software setup is easy. System boots very fast. I am very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: vim

customer_reviews.title: Great drives
customer_reviews.text: Intel SSD, what more can you say but excellent. Got four of these in a Raid 5 system in my Shuttle XPC. Fastest computer I have ever owned in my 30 years experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W McLendon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, and high performance
customer_reviews.text: This was added to a low power Shuttle PC, and it is perfect, since it makes no noise, and since the PC has no fan, it makes for a completely silent computer system.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Odgers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Fast and quiet at a reasonable price point. The rotating drive is now relegated to being a back-up storage device.
customer_reviews.author: Federico Liberatore

customer_reviews.title: Installed in Macbook Pro 13 inch Early 2011 edition
customer_reviews.text: Got sick of my slow 500gb hdd that was in my mbp so I backed everything up. Watched a youtube video on how to replace your hdd with a ssd and now my computer boots up in about 10 seconds. I also did the RAM upgrade on it and am very happy with it. Just wish I could do the graphics card too but oh well. I shouldn't have been cheap when I first bought the macbook pro. Also, 240gb is a lot but I should have maybe looked at 500+gb because I am a data hoarder. Great SDD though for a great price. Did quite a bit of reseach before I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Speed Demon!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Very Nice Upgrade. Replaced a WD Blue Drive on my I-7 box. Data Migration software from Intel cloned the WD boot drive to SSD. Process worked great! I will add that after the software completed the clone, I rebooted the machine, moved the SSD to first boot order and my machine would not boot! A little frustrating at first! Then I discovered the SSD needs to be on SATA port 0. Booted right up! Amazon gets the usual 5 stars for their excellent order and shipping process!
customer_reviews.author: PBG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drive!
customer_reviews.text: This drive is very fast in my laptop, my boot time is very quick now. I have other SSD drive that hang my laptop and this one doesn't. I have nothing but great experiances with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: mcott

customer_reviews.title: SSDs are probably the bigest upgrade you can get
customer_reviews.text: Comes with the 3.5 to 2.5 bay and screws (just make sure you have the orientation correct). Like all SSD the thing is blazing fast. Price to gb is good and quality from intel is always top. If you don't have an SSD that should be your next purchase, they offer the biggest performance upgrade for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smokes the fastest hard drive
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Intel SSD(different machines) and experience is the same every time. Rock solid blazing performance with speeds that leave all hard disks in the dust.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Black Magic Cinema Camera - SSD
customer_reviews.text: Only used it for 3 days of shooting so I can't vouch for it's durability. It captured everything and didn't corrupt files so that's good. One concern is that the SSD got REALLY HOT. So hot I couldn't hold it against my skin for more than 3-5 seconds. This was after several hours of shooting on the BMCC. Which does worry me. I don't know if that's normal, you should research over heating before buying this one. Also, make sure you get the right SATA adapter cord, it's not eSATA which I got confused with at first. Also do not buy that adapter cord at Best Buy, they charged me $45 when you can get it online for like $8.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Really like it.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. The software that came with the drive was very useful to for imaging the old disk then reformatting it after the conversion to the new hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement drive in late 2010 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the stock 500GB hard drive in my MacBook Pro with this drive and the results are nothing short of incredible. Everything loads much faster, especially noticeable in boot times. The computer is now quieter than before without a hard disk spinning at all times. I highly recommend this upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: A. White

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: It works. If you need one, get this one. God, I am so bored of writing reviews of computer stuff that I don't even care about. I want to write reviews on clothes and shoes and CANDY!
customer_reviews.author: PussyCatJustice

customer_reviews.title: Good Drive
customer_reviews.text: But it is not quite as good as the 520 series Intel Series. This drive is great for those older computers with only a SATA 3 controller. If you have a SATA6Gps controller then go with the 520 series.
customer_reviews.author: Dale in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install with great results. Startup time 18 seconds, program initiation less than two seconds. I no longer wait for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I originally was not going to go with a SSD, but I am glad I did. This SSD works great and has made my boot and shutdown speeds extremely fast. Programs open and operate without a any hiccups! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: nice but still overpriced
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit faster than a regular hard drive but not enough to warrant the higher price I will stick to the regular HD till prices come down more.
customer_reviews.author: lanell cameron

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and blazing fast! Very nice. Happy I bought it. Would have been five stars only if it would have installed itself!
customer_reviews.author: John L. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Setup and Driver Installation Are A Problem
customer_reviews.text: This Technology is very promising, however, the SSD Product Drivers required and the conflicts in the various operating systems are sometimes difficult to overcome. I Have installed (2) SSD's with one each of windows 7 and windows xp sp2, as external drives. Both were difficult to get up and running correctly. Finally I was able to Get Them Operational. I Am Not Positive yet, about using the ssd as a C: Drive. I Think More Work Is Needed By The SSD and System Manufacturers in the Plug and Play areas. At This Time I Don't Recommend them, unless you have a SSD Knowledgeable Computer Technician Available. I Consider MySelf more than the Average User.
customer_reviews.author: Chucky Boy

product_meta.title: Intel 335 Series 2.5-Inch 240GB SATA3 Solid State Drive SSDSC2CT240A4K5
product_meta.description: Intel 335 Series SSDSC2CT240A4K5 2.5 inch 240GB SATA3 Solid State Drive (MLC)
